objective_facts: Utilitarianism evaluates outcomes, focusing on the greatest good.
The 'reverse trolley dilemma' scenario complicates utilitarian calculations.

The Socratic Mediator questions the definition of the threshold at which a moral absolute may be overridden.
The concept of 'weighted consequences' is proposed as a potential bridge between utilitarianism and deontological ethics.
A boundary case is proposed regarding the sacrifice of one to save many, distinguishing between actively choosing harm and merely allowing harm.
